headline: Meta Announces Quarterly Cash Dividend
summary: The Meta Platforms, Inc. (Nasdaq: META) board of directors today declared a quarterly cash dividend of $0.525 per share of the company's outstanding Class A common stock and Class B common stock, payable on December 23, 2025 to stockholders of record as of the close of business on December 15, 2025.

(Nasdaq: META) board of directors today declared a quarterly cash dividend of $0.525 per share of the company's outstanding Class A common stock and Class B common stock, payable on December 23, 2025 to stockholders of record as of the close of business on December 15, 2025.

headline: 'Just Beginning,' Awardco Founder On The Superpower That Allowed Him To Build A $1 Billion Business
summary: Awardco co-founder and CEO Steve Sonnenberg says there's one thing that took his company from side hustle to $1 billion business: the ability to just get started. "When it comes to entrepreneurship, my superpower is all about just beginning," Sonnenberg told CNBC last week. "It's very easy for me to start, because that's just who I am." headline: ProShares withdraws some highly leveraged ETF plans after SEC review halt
summary: ETF provider ProShares has withdrawn its registration request for some highly ​leveraged exchange-traded funds after receiving a ‌warning letter from the U.S. securities regulator that flagged risk ‌exposures and paused the review of such plans.  Such letters were sent on Tuesday to nine ETF providers, including ProShares, Direxion and GraniteShares, asking ⁠them to provide ‌more clarity on the risks tied to funds that sought to track ‍up to fives times the performance of the underlying stock.  ProShares had sought approval from the Securities and Exchange ​Commission for ETFs, including products targeting to ‌replicate three times the returns of Wall Street tech giants, including Meta Platforms and Broadcom.

content.title: ProShares withdraws some highly leveraged ETF plans after SEC review halt
content.summary: ETF provider ProShares has withdrawn its registration request for some highly ​leveraged exchange-traded funds after receiving a ‌warning letter from the U.S. securities regulator that flagged risk ‌exposures and paused the review of such plans.  Such letters were sent on Tuesday to nine ETF providers, including ProShares, Direxion and GraniteShares, asking ⁠them to provide ‌more clarity on the risks tied to funds that sought to track ‍up to fives times the performance of the underlying stock.  ProShares had sought approval from the Securities and Exchange ​Commission for ETFs, including products targeting to ‌replicate three times the returns of Wall Street tech giants, including Meta Platforms and Broadcom.

headline: EU to launch antitrust probe into Meta over AI in WhatsApp, FT reports
summary:
STORY: The EU is planning a new antitrust investigation into Meta Platforms.

It's over its rollout of artificial intelligence features in WhatsApp.

That's according to the Financial Times Thursday (December 4).

The move shows how closely authorities are watching Big Tech's use of generative AI on large platforms.

The FT said the European Commission was due to open a probe into how Meta integrated its AI system into the messaging service earlier this year.

Meta AI is a chatbot and virtual assistant.

It's been built into WhatsApp's interface since March this year across European markets.

Meta told Reuters it hasn't received details of the probe.

It further pointed to an earlier WhatsApp statement from an Italian inquiry, which it called “unfounded.”

Italy's antitrust watchdog opened an investigation in July into allegations Meta used its market power by putting an AI tool into WhatsApp.

The probe was expanded in November to see whether Meta further abused its dominance by blocking rival AI chatbots from WhatsApp.

The FT reported the commission is expected to announce the investigation in the coming days, though the timing could change.

content.title: EU to launch antitrust probe into Meta over AI in WhatsApp, FT reports
content.summary:
STORY: The EU is planning a new antitrust investigation into Meta Platforms.

It's over its rollout of artificial intelligence features in WhatsApp.

That's according to the Financial Times Thursday (December 4).

The move shows how closely authorities are watching Big Tech's use of generative AI on large platforms.

The FT said the European Commission was due to open a probe into how Meta integrated its AI system into the messaging service earlier this year.

Meta AI is a chatbot and virtual assistant.

It's been built into WhatsApp's interface since March this year across European markets.

Meta told Reuters it hasn't received details of the probe.

It further pointed to an earlier WhatsApp statement from an Italian inquiry, which it called “unfounded.”

Italy's antitrust watchdog opened an investigation in July into allegations Meta used its market power by putting an AI tool into WhatsApp.

The probe was expanded in November to see whether Meta further abused its dominance by blocking rival AI chatbots from WhatsApp.

The FT reported the commission is expected to announce the investigation in the coming days, though the timing could change.

headline: Meta Hit by EU Antitrust Probe Over WhatsApp’s AI Tools
summary: The European Commission said it’s concerned that new policies implemented by Meta for its WhatsApp AI tools may prevent rival AI providers from offering their business services through WhatsApp in Europe.  Meta will now be forced to submit solutions to appease regulators’ concerns.  “We must ensure European citizens and businesses can benefit fully of this technological revolution and act to prevent dominant digital incumbents from abusing their power to crowd out innovative competitors,” Teresa Ribera, the EU’s antitrust commissioner, said in a statement on Thursday.

content.title: Meta Hit by EU Antitrust Probe Over WhatsApp’s AI Tools
content.summary: The European Commission said it’s concerned that new policies implemented by Meta for its WhatsApp AI tools may prevent rival AI providers from offering their business services through WhatsApp in Europe.  Meta will now be forced to submit solutions to appease regulators’ concerns.  “We must ensure European citizens and businesses can benefit fully of this technological revolution and act to prevent dominant digital incumbents from abusing their power to crowd out innovative competitors,” Teresa Ribera, the EU’s antitrust commissioner, said in a statement on Thursday.

headline: Meta Faces EU Antitrust Probe Over WhatsApp AI Policies It Says Blocks Rival Apps
summary: Meta Platforms is the target of a probe by European Union antitrust regulators over how it governs AI features in its popular WhatsApp chat tool.  Meta stock was slightly higher in Thursday trading despite the new potential regulatory headache.  The European Commission said it has opened the investigation into a Meta policy that "prohibits AI providers from using a tool allowing businesses to communicate with customers via WhatsApp."

content.title: Meta Faces EU Antitrust Probe Over WhatsApp AI Policies It Says Blocks Rival Apps
content.summary: Meta Platforms is the target of a probe by European Union antitrust regulators over how it governs AI features in its popular WhatsApp chat tool.  Meta stock was slightly higher in Thursday trading despite the new potential regulatory headache.  The European Commission said it has opened the investigation into a Meta policy that "prohibits AI providers from using a tool allowing businesses to communicate with customers via WhatsApp."

headline: Meta faces EU probe, Palantir's software deal & Salesforce results
summary: Shares of Meta (META) edged higher ahead of the open, even as the company faces a new antitrust probe in the EU. Regulators are focused on Meta's WhatsApp messaging app and the use of AI on the platform. Separately, Palantir (PLTR) is teaming up with utility company CenterPoint (CNP) and Nvidia (NVDA) to create new software to speed up the building of AI data centers. Salesforce (CRM) shares are rising after third quarter earnings beat expectations. For more live coverage of the markets, watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and visit Yahoo Finance.

content.title: Meta faces EU probe, Palantir's software deal & Salesforce results
content.description:
Shares of Meta (META) edged higher ahead of the open, even as the company faces a new antitrust probe in the EU. Regulators are focused on Meta's WhatsApp messaging app and the use of AI on the platform. Separately, Palantir (PLTR) is teaming up with utility company CenterPoint (CNP) and Nvidia (NVDA) to create new software to speed up the building of AI data centers. Salesforce (CRM) shares are rising after third quarter earnings beat expectations.

For more live coverage of the markets, watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and visit Yahoo Finance.

headline: Meta Risks Temporary Ban on WhatsApp AI Plan Amid EU Probe
summary: Teresa Ribera, the EU’s antitrust chief, said Thursday she’s weighing so-called interim measures “to ensure that this could not blow up.”  Under EU rules, competition regulators can order companies to temporarily stop suspect business practices, but these demands can be challenged in the bloc’s courts in Luxembourg.  Meta will now be forced to submit solutions to appease regulators’ concerns.

content.title: Meta Risks Temporary Ban on WhatsApp AI Plan Amid EU Probe
content.summary: Teresa Ribera, the EU’s antitrust chief, said Thursday she’s weighing so-called interim measures “to ensure that this could not blow up.”  Under EU rules, competition regulators can order companies to temporarily stop suspect business practices, but these demands can be challenged in the bloc’s courts in Luxembourg.  Meta will now be forced to submit solutions to appease regulators’ concerns.

headline: Meta to cut up to 30% of Metaverse budget, Bloomberg News reports
summary: Meta is expected to make ​up to 30% ‌budget cuts for its ‌Metaverse initiative, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with ⁠the discussion. The ‌Facebook-parent, whose shares rose more than ‍6% in premarket trading, did not immediately respond to ​a Reuters request ‌for comment. Meta has been investing heavily in AI products and metaverse - a shared virtual environment ⁠that it ​bets will be ​the successor to the mobile internet.

headline: Stocks Muted Before the Open as Rally Pauses, U.S. Jobless Claims Data on Tap
summary: December S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESZ25) are up +0.02%, and December Nasdaq 100 E-Mini futures (NQZ25) are down -0.01% this morning, taking a breather after recent gains, while investors look ahead to U.S. jobless claims data, which will offer fresh insight into the labor market ahead of next week’s Federal Reserve meeting.
